summary: So is grrm gonna like... end the Targaryen line in the books too? :(
question: So is grrm gonna like... end the Targaryen line in the books too? :(
answer:
House Targaryen will end with me. That made her sad. “You must be my children,” she told the dragons, “my three fierce children. [Barristan] says dragons live longer than men, so you will go on after I am dead.”

It might not end. Yet, if there is any remaining Targaryens, the game of thrones must end. If GRRM truly wants to nail in how bad Feudalistic Monarchies are, he’ll not only destroy the Iron Throne, but also the system behind it. 

The epilogue should have  strong, defined governments that will not leave space for arguments. Perhaps there will be a great council, but don’t expect a king-elect or just a single independent kingdom. The show’s endgame politics were comically unstable, so don’t rely too much on that plot point. 

With the Iron Throne melted, the capital burned by the new Dance/Aery’s wildfire, and the exhaustion of war and winter, it’ll be nearly impossible for anyone to step up to a claim to the Kingdoms.

Personally, I believe the Targaryen dragon dreams always guided them to unite against the army of the dead: 

  • Targaryens arriving on the only island with Dragonglass
  • Bringing Valyrian steel
  • Keeping the bloodlines ~pure~, so that when the time comes, there will be dragon-seeds to burn the army of the dead
  • Aegon uniting the 7 Kingdoms into one force
  • Jaehaerys (albeit cruelly) following prophecy of the PTWP
  • Daenerys waking dragons from stone

House Targaryen seems like the organic weapon building up to win the battle of the dawn. 

The Targaryens purpose was not to rule, but to protect the realm. Once that purpose is over, will there be any remaining Targaryens?

That doesn’t mean that all Targaryen-blooded characters will die. House Martell, the Sand Snakes, House Velaryion, all of Robert’s bastards, Shireen Baratheon and many others might yet live until the end. 

If Targaryens exist after this, they most they can hope for is to rule Dragonstone. Personally, if Jon and Dany ever had a child, I’d love for Arya to raise him/her like Ned raised Lyanna’s son. Safe, happy, and away from the politics. The story returned to a full circle.

Thanks for the question anon xx

summary: Jon and that my queen line was so disturbing they made him sound like a brainwashed person repeating the same line over and over...
body: Jon and that my queen line was so disturbing they made him sound like a brainwashed person repeating the same line over and over again he sounded like  a worshipper Someone Whose only purpose was to serve dany someone Who didn’t have any desire or dream someone Who would’ve happily died for the woman he worshipped this is not Who jon was he was never a follower or someone Who needed anyone’s permission to do what was fair jon would neve have sacrificed his life for a woman who threatened to kill his sister a woman   who killed people because she felt like it, jon fought for the Realm for the leaving so him calling dany my queen doesn’t and will never make sense. Am l still mad   yeah but I’m not mad at him l’m mad at the writers for turning him into something he isn’t and was never .

summary: I personally enjoyed Sansa’s coronation. I still can’t watch it without crying because seeing my girl thrive makes me so...
body: I personally enjoyed Sansa’s coronation. I still can’t watch it without crying because seeing my girl thrive makes me so emotional. Needless to say that her siblings weren’t there because otherwise the cool final montage wouldn’t have been possible. Also, the fact that they’re in different places doesn’t mean that they’re never going to see each other again. Arya will come back home someday, Bran will visit her sister (or the other way around even though Sansa doesn’t like being in King’s Landing), and Jon will pull an uncle Benjen and be home as soon as possible.
